title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: Walter Scott of Wauchope was one of the most popular men in Liddesdale.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: It was a clear, crisp, sunny day, early in March 1813, that the laird ofWauchope was riding into Hawick.

title: Memorials of his time,
author: Cockburn, Henry Cockburn
snippet: * Near Edinburgh, the seat of Andrew Wauchope, Esq., of Niddrie.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Mrs. Fall, a genius in painting; fullj^ more clever in the fine arts and sciences tiian my friend Lady Wauchope, without lier consummate

title: The complete works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Wauchope — Mr. Scott exactly the figure and face commonly given to Sancho Panca — very shrewd in his farming matters, and uot unfrequently  stumbles on -what may be called a strong thing rather than a good thing.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Set out next morning for Wauchope, the seat of my correspondent, Mrs. Scott — breakfast by the -way -with Dr. Elliot, an agreeable, goodhearted,  climate-beaten old veteran, in the medical line ; no-w retired to a romantic, but rather moorish place, on the banks of the Eoole — he accompanies us almost to AVauchope — we traverse the country to the top of Bochester, the scene of an old encampment, and Woolee Hill.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: It is easy then to guess how much I was gratified with the countenance and approbation  of one of my country's most illustrious sons, when Mr. Wauchope called on me yesterday  on the part of your lordship.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Burns made his way to Wauchope, the residence  of Mrs. Scott, who had welcomed him into the world as a poet in verses lively and graceful : he found her, he said, " a lady of sense and taste, and of a decision peculiar to female authors."

title: Murmurings from rugged waters.
author: Broomfield, James Polwarth. [from old catalog]
snippet: By gallant Wauchope's side; And now her youngest, and her all.
